abstract.para: You can use the nmcli connection modify command to modify network connections.
You can set a static IP address, DNS server, Gateway, change connection name, change Wi-Fi SSID for Wi-Fi connections, and enable or disable autoconnect using the nmcli connection modify command.

step.para: View the list of connections using the command:
The list of available active network connections appear with the names and UUIDs.
To view the status of all network interfaces, run the following command:
Modify a connection using the following command:
step.screen: nmcli connection modify connection-name property value

step.para: To set a static IP address, run the following command:
step.screen: nmcli connection modify connection-name ipv4.addresses IP-address/prefix-length nmcli connection modify connection-name ipv4.method manual

step.para: To set DNS servers, run the following command:
To set gateway, run the following command:
step.screen: nmcli connection modify connection-name ipv4.gateway gateway-ip

step.para: To change connection name, run the following command:
step.screen: nmcli connection modify old-connection-name connection.id new-connection-name

step.para: To modify the Wi-Fi SSID, run the following command:
To enable autoconnect, run the following command:
step.screen: nmcli connection modify connection-name connection.autoconnect yes

step.para: To disable autoconnect, run the following command:
step.screen: nmcli connection modify connection-name connection.autoconnect no

step.para: To apply the changes, bring the network connection down and then up using the following commands:
step.screen: nmcli connection down connection-name nmcli connection up connection-name
